Joe and Helen Roberts, of Blakiston Street, Fleetwood, were reported to the police by a Wyre Council official after Mr Roberts said he was offended by the authority's promotion of homosexual rights.

 "offended"?

The couple had campaigned for Wyre Council to promote Christianity as well as distributing leaflets about gay rights.

 Anybody else notice the disparency here?
 We're talking about leaflets promoting gay RIGHTS (a group that is typically discriminated against), and the comparative response is to promote CHRISTIANITY itself.
 I realize some on the right can't get the difference, but there is a analogical difference between promoting gay RIGHTS and Christianity.
 A more accurate analogy would be to promote Christian RIGHTS along with gay RIGHTS, but since Christians (the group) aren't being discriminated against (from what we see in the story), the whole thing is an absurd request.

 Interesting.

Two police officers went to the Roberts' home and grilled them about their beliefs for more than an hour.
 Officers brought no charges, but the Roberts took action on the grounds that their rights to freedom of speech and freedom of religion under the European Convention on Human Rights had been breached.
 Now the case has been settled after Wyre Council and Lancashire Constabulary apologised to the couple. They were paid legal costs and £10,000 which will be donated to charity.
